docs.lead_paragraph: A month ago, D. Larry Smith took a "neutral," position on drug stocks, the group he follows as an analyst for Smith Barney, Harris Upham. But by last week, after the ailing drugs had suffered yet another spill in the market, he had turned largely negative.

headline.main: INVESTING; Bitter Pills for the Drug Stocks

docs.abstract: Article on drug stocks; says leading stocks have had earnings multiples cut back by 1/2 to 2/3; factors noted; example of Squibb Corp cited; graph of drug stocks slide from '73 to '76 (M)
docs.snippet: A month ago, D. Larry Smith took a "neutral," position on drug stocks, the group he follows as an analyst for Smith Barney, Harris Upham. But by last week, after the ailing drugs had suffered yet another spill in the market, he had turned largely...

docs.lead_paragraph: ONE of the time-honored legislative ways to begin to deal with thorny problems that defy immediate solution is to study them, a tactic that can open any legislature to charges that it is so busy studying problems that it fails to come to grips with them.
docs.abstract: list of issues under consideration by NJ Legis that may result in creation of special study comms, venerable legislative tactic for dealing with thorny problems that defy immediate solution; tactic seen inviting charges that Legis is so busy studying problems that it fails to come to grips with them (L)
docs.snippet: ONE of the time-honored legislative ways to begin to deal with thorny problems that defy immediate solution is to study  them, a tactic that can open any legislature to charges that it is so busy studying problems that it fails to come to grips with...

headline.main: Around the Nation; Radioactive Cloud Passes Without Danger to Earth Louisiana Teachers Vote On Integration Merger Better Economy Credited For Dip in Food Stamp Use Higher Cost of Health Care Attributed to Inflation Hearing May Be Advanced In Utah Execution Case

docs.abstract: La Teachers Assn and La Educ Assn, with predominantly white and black members, respectively, under pressure from NEA, to vote on proposed merger plan (S)
